page.title: 08PURE SCAYNES HILL WATER
page.content: SCAYNES HILL 378245 When people use water,it becomes dirty.When it flows down the drain,it becomes the business of the treatment plant to re-cycle it.The plant first removes rubbish from the water by using screens,which are metal bars placed close together.When the rubbish has been removed the water is put into large tanks called clarifiers;there the solids settle to the bottom and is called crude sludge.The clarifier makes it cleaner by adding coagulant. Chlorine is then added which destroys bacteria.Sulphur dioxide is added to reduce the chlorine.When the water is clean it is put into a service reservoir from where it is taken to be used or put back into the water cycle. Water consumption in 1972 was 225 liters per head per day,and this figure is still rising.
